description.other_contributors: Ian McNicoll, Ocean Informatics, United Kingdom (Editor)
description.other_details: Goal, Draft Archetype [Internet]. National eHealth Transition Authority, NEHTA Clinical Knowledge Manager [cited: 2015-04-30]. Available from: http://dcm.nehta.org.au/ckm/#showArchetype_1013.1.1093

details.purpose: لتسجيل الأهداف العامة و الأهداف المُحَدَّدة القابلة للقياس (و ربما الإضافية) المؤدية إلى الهدف العام.
To record details about an aim or desired health state or goal that is likely to contribute to improving the overall health of the subject of care.
details.use: Use to record a health-related goal, as well as one or more specific, measurable targets that will support assessment of success or allow for recording difficulties in achieving the target.

items.items: *A desired future health state for the subject of care.(en)
*The name of the desired health state.(en)
*For example: reduced blood pressure; 10 kilogram weight loss; or diabetes control.(en)
*The date by which it is intended that the goal will be achieved.(en)
*The actual date the goal was successfully completed or removed from the record for other reasons.(en)

*Multiple targets are allowed. In some situations, only one target will be required. In some clinical scenarios the goal may require a multifaceted approach with a number of targets contributing to a successful goal outcome. In addition, some goals may require incremental targets to be set sequentially during a period of time.(en)
*The archetype and path to the node for target data.(en)
*For example: the 'Weight' data element in the OBSERVATION.body_weight archetype.(en)
*The proposed date for achieving the target.(en)
*The actual date the target was successfully completed or removed from the record for other reasons.(en)
*The clinical problem or diagnosis which is intended to be effected by this goal.(en)
*For example: Hypertension; Obesity; or Diabetes Type 2.(en)
*Identification of the intended target, by name.(en)
*For example: weight reduction; or blood sugar control.(en)
*A narrative description of the goal, including target/s to be achieved if relevant.(en)
*Single word, phrase or brief description which represents the outcome actually achieved for the goal.(en)
*Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: target weight acheived; poor diabetes control; or successful completion.(en)
*Single word, phrase or brief description which represents the outcome actually achieved for the target.(en)

*Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible. This data element could represent success or failure, or some state in between when the goal is completed or abandoned/removed from the record. For example: poor blood sugar control, or successful completion.(en)
*Additional narrative about the goal not captured in other fields.(en)
*For example: the reason why the goal was not achieved, or a description about how the goal was partially achieved.(en)
*Additional narrative about the target not captured in other fields.(en)
*For example: the reason why the target was not achieved, or a description about how the target was partially achieved.(en)
A desired future health state for the subject of care.
The name of the desired health state.
For example: reduced blood pressure; 10 kilogram weight loss; or diabetes control.
The date by which it is intended that the goal will be achieved.
The actual date the goal was successfully completed or removed from the record for other reasons.

Multiple targets are allowed. In some situations, only one target will be required. In some clinical scenarios the goal may require a multifaceted approach with a number of targets contributing to a successful goal outcome. In addition, some goals may require incremental targets to be set sequentially during a period of time.
The archetype and path to the node for target data.
For example: the 'Weight' data element in the OBSERVATION.body_weight archetype.
The proposed date for achieving the target.
The actual date the target was successfully completed or removed from the record for other reasons.
The clinical problem or diagnosis which is intended to be effected by this goal.
For example: Hypertension; Obesity; or Diabetes Type 2.
Identification of the intended target, by name.
For example: weight reduction; or blood sugar control.
A narrative description of the goal, including target/s to be achieved if relevant.
Single word, phrase or brief description which represents the outcome actually achieved for the goal.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: target weight acheived; poor diabetes control; or successful completion.
Single word, phrase or brief description which represents the outcome actually achieved for the target.

Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible. This data element could represent success or failure, or some state in between when the goal is completed or abandoned/removed from the record. For example: poor blood sugar control, or successful completion.
Additional narrative about the goal not captured in other fields.
For example: the reason why the goal was not achieved, or a description about how the goal was partially achieved.
Additional narrative about the target not captured in other fields.
For example: the reason why the target was not achieved, or a description about how the target was partially achieved.
Narrative description about the intended target.
